fullplot: JOSHUA TREE, 1951 is an intimate portrait of James Dean on the cusp of achieving notoriety as both a great actor and an American icon. Set primarily in the early 1950s and focusing on Dean's experiences as an up-and-coming actor in Los Angeles, the film is a series of revealing and sometimes dreamlike vignettes that blend biographical and fictionalized elements to present a pivotal moment in a remarkable life.
plot: An intimate and dreamlike portrait of icon James Dean on the cusp of achieving fame.
title: Joshua Tree, 1951: A Portrait of James Dean
